intro: Cystopora elatiocarpa, commonly known as the golden thorn, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Zingiberaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and spiny stems. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous coating. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
